text: Mansour bin Muqrin bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (1973 â€“ November 5, 2017) was a Saudi businessman, member of the House of Saud, and Advisor at the Court of the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia. In April 2015, he was appointed Advisor to the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques with the rank of minister. He was the son of Prince Muqrin al-Saud, former Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia. He was a partner in Ethan Allen's Saudi franchise. bin Muqrin died in a helicopter crash near Abha on November 5, 2017 at the age of 43 or 44. ==References== Category:1973 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Aviation deaths Category:Saudi Arabian politicians Category:Princes and princesses Category:Saudi Arabian businesspeople
title: Mansour bin Muqrin
